name: Aakaash R.
title: Learning to Play the Piano
description: For my MYP personal project, I decided to prepare the required repertoire pieces and studies for an RCM grade 2 practical exam on the piano. The global context I selected was personal and cultural expression, focusing on the personal aspect of it, exploring my identity and learning to express my emotions through different parts of the musical arts. Music has always been a passion of mine with the guitar and bass, so I took this opportunity to further delve into the world of music with a new instrument - the piano.

name: Akshay S.
title: Learning to Play the Harmonica
description: The goal of my personal project was to be able to play and compose using the harmonica, with which I wanted to write a short piece. This fell into the category of personal and cultural expression. My piece was written using mostly the harmonica, but also the guitar as a backing track over which I played the harmonica.

name: Aman Y.
title: Learning to make a hip-hop/R&B beat
description: For my Personal Project I decided to make a cool catchy beat that would fit in the genre of Hip-Hop or R&B, my goal was to understand and replicate various beats used in Hip Hop and R&B to make a pleasing/catchy instrumental. The first part of my beat is an into that I sampled from a popular artist so you might recognize it, and the my beat comes in after that. Enjoy!

name: Andy G.
title: Training a Puppy
description: Over these 2-3 months, my goal was to teach my dog how to sit, speak, jump, catch a ball and give me his paw by spending 45 minutes with him every 2-3 days practicing each of these elements sufficiently. Having your pet trained is important and a great responsibility that has to be taken care of with great precision and I took on this challenge so when others see my dog they wouldn't think he is scary, but rather fun and playful.

name: Arjun J.
title: Arjun's Home
description: The goal of this project is to understand the housing crisis that people with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) face in my community, and to devise a strategy to combat this problem. ​I look to create an environment where people with ASD are safe, and can feel comfortable — a place where all members of the family can flourish.

name: Ashveen A.
title: Learning how to make professional short films
description: Every since I was a little boy, I would appreciate everything around me. Nature was a big part of my life and filming all sorts of creatures at a young age has enabled me to upgrade my skills. My personal project not only consists of the film itself, but also branches into four marked segments; such as the storyboard,  script, acting and music. By end of the work period of my project, I achieved the goal of gaining professional editing/filming experience. I know that this is a skills worth learning as several short films have guided me in the right direction. Due to technical difficulties, most of my project has been unknowingly deleted; here is a sample of what's left of the editing.

name: Ashwin K.
title: Ruban's Cookbook - A guide to immerse yourself in Sri Lankan cuisine
description: The goal of this cookbook is to educate people on Sri Lankan cuisine by providing the reader of the cookbook with recipes and teaching the reader various bits of information on Sri Lankan whilst cooking the meals. The recipes in the cookbook consist of two full course meals and one interesting fusion meal that incorporates Sri Lankan cuisine and infuses it with another cuisine. The reason for choosing this as my personal project stems from a multitude of reasons. I have always been interested in cooking and decided that this project opportunity was the perfect time to learn a new skill. Learning how to cook has a multitude of benefits as well, one being the ability to expand one's knowledge of personal and cultural expression. This is incredibly important as it is important to acknowledge one's cultural background.

name: Austin S.
title: Essentials of Sichuan Cuisine - A Cookbook
description: For my personal project I decided to take on the challenge of making a cookbook with the goal of making 12 or more Sichuan style dishes and recipes. The global context that my project explores is personal and cultural expression. This is because my project helps me explore my roots and teaches more more about my culture through food. Just as a little disclaimer, I have never done anything like this before so, the lower your expectations, the more surprised you will be. Anyways, I hope you enjoy it!
video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T5o_0BoTvWg&ab_channel=TylerMontgomery    Link for the actual video: https://youtu.be/8ndXXB-cGkY

name: Bianca M.
title: Highlighting major stories of Falsely Convicted Death Row Felons
description: The first couple of posts on my blog, are two stories written without bias, about two men who were falsely convicted of performing first degree murder. They lived on death row, while proving their innocence, but because of their race, the case was not opened till 20+ years later. I wanted to create this blog, to use my platform to bring attention to these stories.

name: Bilal S.
title: Phony Doctor
description: For my personal project, I will be taking 2 broken phones that do not work and fixing them up, creating fully functioning phones. I chose to repair two phones, an iPhone 8+ and a OnePlus 2. My global context falls under scientific and technical innovation and the inquiry question that I am looking to answer is how does the repairing of phones tie into the environment and my understanding of scientific and technological innovation?
special1info: Link to Full Album of Photos

name: Brian L.
title: Becoming the Fingerstyle Guitar Hero
description: Here is my performance of the song Say You Won’t Let Go by James Arthur and the song Let Her Go by Passenger in Fingerstyle guitar. My personal project goal was to be able to play guitar as a performance in front of others. I have chosen these two pieces because I believe that they demonstrate a warm and easygoing nature of myself. I hope you enjoy!

name: Bright W.
title: War and How It Impacts Humanity, Society, and Us
description: It is about the evolution of how war has impacted us, as well as several other components that have changed, including the term War itself. The Global Contexts that fit into this are Identities and Relationships, Fairness and Development, and Scientific and Technical Innovation.

name: Christine Y.
title: Cookbook of Korean Foods
description: Tackling the global context of Personal and Cultural Expression, this cookbook features 9 Korean recipes ranging from old-timey rice dishes to newer, more "contemporary" drinks to keep you alive in any, and every season. It doesn't matter how little cooking OR baking experience you have (take me for example, I'm still amazed that this was possible >.>). You will be able to bring the sweet aroma of South Korea right to your kitchen- no stress!

name: Crystal Z.
title: Creating a Short Animatic
description: I have always been inspired by the power of film and its power to resonate with others in unimaginable ways. My product, based on my background experience in visual arts, is an animatic aimed to express my personal thoughts and identity. If my voice could reach out, latch on to the fibers of your being, and spark a curiosity, then maybe this interconnectedness isn't so unimaginable after all — and my work would be proof of that.  Please read the description of the YouTube video for more details regarding my piece.

name: David C.
title: Creating an original musical composition
description: I chose to do this personal project because of three reasons. Firstly, I have always had a big passion for music, and secondly, I wanted to challenge myself with something new, while still in the category of music. Finally, I also wanted to be able to express myself into this piece, while expanding my creativity in music, which falls under the Global Context< Personal and Cultural Values. While creating this composition, I used the website, Note Flight to write all the music down.

name: Edward S.
title: Exploring & Impicturing Lyrical Narration
description: Three lyrically written songs (no singing or music :/) compiled into an anthology/album. The songs share one storyline and each tell a different perspective or event. This project is listed under Personal and Cultural Expression and has been quite a surprisingly fun endeavour. Hope you enjoy finding your own interpretation of the story!

name: Evelyn J.
title: Learning Braille
description: I wanted to translate one children's book and write my own children's book in braille, to learn more about the blind community and broaden my understanding of how privileged I am. It helped me understand the challenges blind people face and also allowed me to learn more about the challenges blind people face on a daily basis. The global context I chose is Identities and Relationships.
special2info: Link to Book 2 - "This Is Who I Am"

name: Jasmine M.
title: Chisine! An Educational Board Game
description:
My personal project was making a board game to teach others about Chinese cuisine. The goal was to include approximately 50 dishes and 50 corresponding ingredients to show others the diversity of Chinese cuisine. I also decided on the global context "Personal and Cultural Expression" because my project helped me explore aspects of my culture and find out more about my roots. 

My board game showcases my months of research on the different regions of cuisine in China and the various dishes and ingredients that can be found in each region. The main content of the game can be found on the dish and ingredient cards. As well, there are other parts of my game such as the game board, dice, instructions, tokens, player pieces, and cards. All of these elements ensure the player has fun while learning about Chinese cuisine!

name: Johnny G.
title: Building Snake in python3
description: I used python3, a programming language, to recreate the game Snake. Snake is a game about trying to grow by eating apples, all while trying not to collide with oneself or the walls.

name: Kelly V.
title: Cooking with Mama!
description: By family day, I wanted to cook a meal for my family. The catch is that all the dishes must be from my cultural background. I succeeded my goals and created wonderful dishes.

name: Leon M.
title: Learning to Cook
description: My personal project was to learn how to cook healthy western and traditional dishes to prepare myself for univeristy. After all, who really wants to eat instant noodles for 15 meals in a row? This would fall under the "Personal & Cultural Expression" Global Context

name: Madeeha N.
title: Knitting a Blanket
description: My goal for my personal project was to successfully knit an entire queen sized blanket, and my global context was personal and cultural expression.  My blanket is 7'' by 8'' and is made up of 3 different colors: grey, black and blue.

name: Michael C.
title: Python Coding YouTube Channel
description: The goal for my personal project was to make 5-10 python projects and upload video's to YouTube showing how to code them.  I was able to complete this goal while also gaining 33 subscribers and gaining over 100 views in total.  I've had some experience with coding in python and making YouTube video's before, but I wanted to put a spin on it where the python projects can be applicable to the real world and can help to automate boring tasks.

name: Muhammad A.
title: Learning to Make a Pakistani Dinner
description: My goal was to learn how to make a Pakistani dinner, which relates to the global context of cultural and personal expression. I was able to learn how to make three dishes, each one representing an appetizer, main course and desert. Veggie rolls were made for the appetizer, chicken karahi for the main course and suji ka halwa as dessert.

name: Nicholas L.
title: Filming and editing promotional video for TDS Dance Space
description:
The purpose of my project is to help promote a business during the pandemic using my newly developed video-making skills. 
My SMART goal is to film and edit a promotional video for TDS Dance Space using cinematic clips and interviews before February 15th, 2021.
I chose the global context, “Identities and Relationships” because it relates the most to what I have to do for my project, like contacting people in my community.

name: Nitya K.
title: Learning to Cook 10 Telugu Dishes & Creating a Cookbook
description: I chose to cook 10 South Indian, more specifically Telugu, dishes and make an accessible cookbook. Through this project, my aim was to develop my identity and relationships, as well as my personal and cultural expression. I put my amateur cooking skills to test by making a variety of dishes ranging from breakfast items to desserts. The process involved many hours spent on research (both from online sources and family members), lots of preparation to make the cooking experience smooth, and constant scribbling of recipes in my notes. Overall, it was a very enjoyable and fulfilling experience, despite the challenges.
special1info: Link to Cookbook (School Account to Access)

name: Sirma S.
title: Writing a Short Story
description: My goal was to write about 30 pages of a short story including pictures so that it could be like a small graphic novel. The global context that it is connected to is personal and cultural expression.
special1info: Link to Story (School Account to Access)

name: Sneha P.
title: Cultural Expression through Hand Sewn Designs
description: The goal of my chosen topic is to deepen my understanding of my culture as well as expressing this newly acquired knowledge through a creative medium I haven’t practiced before. I mastered various types of embroidery patterns to create a handmade personalized home decoration item for my family, friends and visitors to enjoy during their stay. As well, the “Personal and Cultural Expression,” global context, granted me the chance to flourish my creativity through fun and enjoyable means, thereby I am utmost grateful for the personal project.

name: Sophia D.
title: Indoor Home Gardening - A small scale experiment
description:
In our rapidly populating and urbanising society, the question of sustainable food production and practice comes up a lot. With agricultural production and transportation accounting for a significant proportion of the world’s CO2 emissions, now is an important time to consider alternative methods of food production. 
One commonly proposed solution is to move agriculture into urban centres by having communities and households grow a portion of their own fruits and vegetables. 
In this personal project, guided by the global context of globalisation and sustainability, I designed and built a small-scale indoor environment to grow vegetables in, to see if it would make a difference in my family’s food consumption, and to evaluate its potential as a realistic solution for other households.

name: Stella X.
title: Writing a Musical
description: I wrote the book of a musical along with three of its songs to express myself personally but not really culturally. Note that everything is a draft that I plan to continue working on, so it's all far from perfect. Also note that I can't sing. Also note that the songs won't really make sense unless you read the text, so I highly recommend at least starting down the PDF (pretty please, I worked hard). Also note that some songs have not yet been written: "SINGING: " and subsequent text is just a content placeholder for those songs. Lyrics are in the text, you'll have to scroll. That's it - hope you enjoy at least a little!

name: Stuthy S.
title: Reinventing Old Clothing
description: My personal project was to reinvent my old clothing into something that I would wear today.

name: Tae Yeon H.
title: Learning to Play the Guitar
description: My goal was to play the song of my choice on the electric guitar flawlessly without any mistakes, and record it to make my cover. To do this, I have consistently practiced. My global context is: Personal and cultural expression. I also want to demonstrate my personal expressions and ideas through the music I play.

name: Varun D
title: The World needs help, a video by Varun Dhanam
description: My MYP personal project is a 25min video outlining 4 vastly different environmental issues that our earth is currently facing. The video also talks about ways people can help stop/lessen the effects of these issues. I used some stuffed animals I had at home as different characters and performed voiceovers for them, losing my voice in the process. I was also fortunate enough to find a site called Animaker! A free site used to make animations. I put it to use for my video as well. The global context I chose was Scientific and Technological Innovation. I thoroughly enjoyed making this video and learnt a lot during the process. A huge thanks to my supervisor, Mrs. Wang-Martin, for guiding me through it.

name: Vishwa S.
title: Learning The Art of Graphic Design
description:
For my personal project, I decided to learn the art of Graphic Design. I took online courses, read books, consulted websites to familiarize myself with the basics of graphic design. Then I repeated it for the elements of design. 

My goal was to simplify complex topics and make them more accessible to my generation. That's why I converted books' lessons to intuitive graphics!

To constantly hone my skills, I posted at least 10 graphics a week on an Instagram account @learning.simplified. I covered financial topics like Bitcoin, as well as many books! I talked about "How to Win Friends and Influence People" by Dale Carnegie, "Rich Dad Poor Dad" by Robert Kiyosaki and "Make Your Bed: Little Things That Can Change Your Life...And Maybe the World" by Admiral McRaven.

name: William Y.
title: Making a Recipe Blog
description:
My project is about creating a cookbook (now recipe blog) of traditional Chinese dishes to help me reconnect with my culture and share my food with everyone.
My global context is personal and cultural expression and my goal was that by February 2021, I will have learned how to cook, and have created a fully-fledged cookbook of, various traditional Chinese recipes through following techniques and steps learned from my parents as well as looking up variations of the recipes online.

name: Xiwen H.
title: Crochet Bucket Hats
description: I've always been interested in the arts and it was sad that my enthusiasm only continued to diminish over time. So, I decided to explore a new medium (I guess crochet is more of a craft), while also further developing my knowledge of relationships between local and global processes. What better way to do that if not selling the bucket hats I've learned to crochet for lots of money? Disregarding the fact that I never got around to the actual selling part, learning how to crochet and then becoming a slave to the hook and yarn was enjoyable enough. I'm glad that I was able to pursue this lost interest of mine while learning about small businesses.
special1info: Link to Layout (School Account to Access)

name: Zainab S.
title: Learning How to Create Pottery Pieces
description: At the beginning of November, I set a goal to learn how to create two functioning pottery pieces. With the help of online resources, my parents, and my supervisor, I taught myself how to work with clay. As a result, I also realized the significance and versatility of pottery in my culture.
